Dialogue.NPCText:
A striking woman leans over a battered map spread across a crate. Her hands are wrapped in silver-threaded gloves, dusted with sand. She glances up, quick and appraising.

"Another seeker? Or are you one of Seraphine’s spies? Either way, Sunreach has a way of blurring the lines. I am Aria Silverhand—archaeologist, sometimes historian, sometimes... something else. State your purpose."

Option.text: I heard you need skilled help in Sunreach.
You seem on edge. Trouble with the Council?
What brings an archaeologist to a city of pirates?
Is it true you deal with Aerilon’s mages?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She gives a wry smile.

"Sunreach is a crossroads, a vault, and a grave for secrets—my kind of place. After Minax burned Moonglow’s libraries, knowledge scattered like sand. I followed the rumors here. These ruins below Sunreach? They're older than the city itself—and perhaps the key to ending Minax’s shadow."

"But secrets have teeth. That’s why I keep my allegiances flexible."

Option.text: Do you seek relics to fight Minax?
Sounds dangerous. How do you survive?
I’m ready for work, if you have it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Aria’s voice drops.

"The Council is a viper’s nest. Darius wants my finds. Seraphine wants my silence. Hassan means well, but his rivals don’t care who gets trampled. You can trust everyone here—until you can’t."

Option.text: So you walk a dangerous line.
Work is work. What do you need done?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She grins slyly.

"Aerilon pays in secrets, Sunreach pays in gold. I trade both. Their mages hunger for ancient tech, and I happen to know where the bones of the world are buried. If you’re clever, you can play the cities off one another. Just don’t get caught."

Option.text: You sound like you need a trustworthy ally.
Do you have a job for me?

Dialogue.NPCText: "You survive by staying useful. And by never letting anyone know how much you really know. Let’s see if you’re as resourceful as you look."

Option.text: On second thought, I’ll stay out of trouble.

Dialogue.NPCText: "I collect stories. Sometimes those stories save lives. Sometimes, they end them. I suppose I want to decide which."

Option.text: Let’s make history, then. What’s the task?
I’ll leave you to your stories.

Dialogue.NPCText: She arches an eyebrow. "Trust? That’s a word with many meanings in Sunreach. But if you prove yourself, we can do business. Dangerous, but profitable."
Aria returns to her map. "Suit yourself. If you ever crave adventure or coin, you know where to find me."

Aria lowers her voice.

"Listen carefully. Beneath Sunreach lies a vault—a relic chamber from before Minax’s rise. I believe it holds an artifact capable of disrupting her magic: the **Aegis Shard**. Trouble is, I’m not the only one hunting for it. Minax cultists, council thugs, and pirates all want a piece."

"I need someone *unaffiliated* to recover the Aegis Shard and bring it to me. You’ll have to outwit traps, bribe or fight your way past cultists, and avoid the council’s informers."

Option.text: Why trust me with something so valuable?
Tell me more about the Aegis Shard.
I’m ready. Where do I start?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Because I don’t trust anyone in Sunreach’s power circles. Outsiders have fewer strings attached. If you cross me, you’ll wish you hadn’t. If you deliver, you’ll earn my trust—and much more."

Option.text: I accept. Where is the vault?
I want to know more about this artifact first.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The Aegis Shard is said to be a fragment of the Gem of Immortality—before Minax began gathering the shards. It warps magic, shields against corruption, and in the wrong hands... could level cities. That’s why I want it hidden from the council—and from Minax."

Option.text: Let’s get to it. Where is the vault?

Dialogue.NPCText: "The ruins are infested with cultists loyal to Minax, and booby-trapped by whoever built them. Some say the dead walk in those tunnels. If stealth fails, fight hard or run fast. And don’t trust anyone offering ‘guidance’ down there—they’re probably on someone’s payroll."

Aria produces a battered map and a strange silver key.

"This map marks the hidden entrance. The key opens the inner vault. Retrieve the Aegis Shard and return—do not hand it to anyone else, not even a council member. If you succeed, you’ll be paid in both coin and favor—perhaps even a secret or two from Aerilon."

"But beware. If you’re caught, I’ll deny ever knowing you."

Option.text: I changed my mind. Too dangerous.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Go swiftly—and quietly. Return only when you have the Shard. Trust no one."

Aria leans back against a crate, her silver hair catching the lantern light.

"Curious, are we? Most here don’t bother asking. But fine—ask your questions. Just don’t expect all the answers to be true."

Option.text: Why do you risk so much for relics?
Do you serve Aerilon… or yourself?
I’ve heard rumors you were once part of the Moonglow Circle.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Born near the Lyceum, raised on scrolls, exiled over a theory no one believed. Moonglow valued tradition—too much. I asked questions they didn't like. One day my mentor vanished, and I was told never to return.

So I started digging—literally. The ruins beneath us speak louder than any court wizard."

Option.text: So you turned exile into purpose.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Bitterness is for those who lost something. I gained freedom, danger, and more insight than they ever offered. But yes... I miss the stars over Moonglow."

She chuckles softly.

"Exactly. I chose motion over mourning. There's power in stories, especially the buried ones."

"Relics reshape kingdoms. One artifact in the wrong hands can doom cities. I don’t seek gold—I seek leverage."

She leans forward. "And if I can rewrite the ending Minax has planned? That’s worth any risk."
She laughs. "Hardly. I just want the world to remember who *actually* did the work when the dust settles."
"I prefer *adaptive*. If I know who’s lying, I can lie better."

"Silverhand? That’s not birthright. It’s memory. After an expedition went wrong, I lost this arm to a sand wyrm. The replacement was forged from Aerilon alloy and Moonglow enchantments. A symbol of who I was... and who I became."

Option.action: SendMessage:She flexes the fingers of her gloved hand, but keeps it mostly covered.
SendMessage:Her silver eyes soften for a moment.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Aerilon pays well. But make no mistake—I serve my own interests. Their floating towers and smug archmages hide secrets too dark for even Seraphine to stomach."

"Still... useful partners. And enemies, sometimes."

She narrows her eyes. "Who told you that?"

[If you're lucky, she may tell you more...]

Option.action: SendMessage:You feel her measuring you for lies.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She sighs.

"Yes. I was part of the Circle of Seven for a time. I walked the Ley Paths. I even helped bind a shard once. But I saw what it cost. We thought we were immortal. We were wrong."

"Now I work in the dirt. It's more honest."

Option.text: You were one of the Seven? That’s… incredible.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"People who listen more than they speak. People who run *toward* danger without pretending they're noble. People who don’t ask questions they already know the answers to."

"You might be one of them... or you might be watching for Seraphine. Time will tell."

Option.text: Then let time speak for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The ruins speak. The stars whisper. The power beneath Sunreach *trembles*. I dig to understand what broke the world—before Minax breaks it again."

"That, and I enjoy a good puzzle."

She studies you, expression unreadable.

"You’re either wasting my time... or you're someone I can use."
Then, with a sudden grin: "Prove you're the latter, and I might just share a real secret next time."
